issue.title: [CF 818] Prayer of Mending
issue.body:
I've been digging up my priest and tried making an icon for tracking Prayer of Mending. The idea is that I can get an icon alerting me if nobody in the raid is affected by my Prayer of Mending. Unfortunately checking raid 1-40 checks whether any of the raid members have Prayer of Mending missing, not if they all have it missing. And checking for every raidmember separately would require 40 conditions.
Also there's the minor issue that the icon always thinks that Mending is missing between the moment that it fades on one player and it gets applied on another. I can work around that by starting a 0.5 second combat event timer when Mending fades and connecting that as an icon shown condition with the main icon, making the main icon wait 0.5 seconds before taking action. Is there maybe a more elegant solution?


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #818 | Raw

comments.body:
This seems to be doing the job for me:

^1^T^SUnit^Sraid;~`party;~`player ^SOnlyMine^B ^SType^Sbuff ^SName^SPrayer~`of~`Mending ^SShowWhen^N1 ^SEnabled^B ^t^N62201^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

You will probably want to add a condition to check the cooldown.

As far as preventing the icon from showing while it is jumping goes - there isn't really any elegant solution to this. A combat event timer would be how it would need to be implemented in any sort of internal implementation as well.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Wouldn't it be somehow possible to only update the icon in the event that Prayer of Mending had 1 stack remaining when it was consumed? (or faded because of time)


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Your icon does work. This icon however:

^1^T^SCLEUEvents^T ^SSPELL_AURA_REMOVED^B ^t^SType^Scleu ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SBUFFDUR ^SChecked^B ^SUnit^Sraid;`party;`player ^SName^SPrayer`of`Mending ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SShowTimerText^B ^SClockGCD^B ^SName^SPrayer`of`Mending ^SCLEUDur^N1 ^SSourceUnit^Splayer ^SShowWhen^N1 ^SShowTimer^B ^SEnabled^B ^t^N62203^S`| ^Sicon^^

does not. Even though it's checking basically the same thing. Except it's checking raid; party; player in a condition instead of on the main page.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Conditions only accept one unit. That condition is just checking "raid1".


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Does the condition not move on to the next unit if the condition isn't met?


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

No. There is no code implemented for iterating over multiple units for any conditions.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
